Dear Mrs. Prudhomme:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159 Youth restraint; pregnant youth;
Section reduction, prevention; prohibited restraints; elimination of
Description restraints.
1

(4) Only the least restrictive intervention necessary to prevent
immediate harm to the youth or others may be used and must
follow an individualized set of graduated interventions that avoid
the use of restraints.
Violation Type Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Allegation Youth was placed in an unwarranted restraint.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on May 22,
2023. Complainant did not have further information.
Youth was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on May
31, 2023. Youth said she was walking side by side with Staff 1
and Staff 2 down the Village Road from the Career Technical
Center (CTC) to Sherk House and Staff 3 was walking behind
them. Youth said she and Staff 1 had their arms hooked
together and she felt they were walking at “a fast pace” and so
she slowed down and Staff 3 suddenly “grabbed her arm” and
put her in a restraint. Youth said she dropped and sat down at
which time Staff 3 placed in her a restraint with her arms behind
her head and back. Youth said Staff 3 told her to stand up and
so she did, and he continued to hold her as she was walking
forward. Youth said Staff 3 was holding tight and she asked him
to let go, and he refused and so she sat on the ground again.
Youth said Staff 3 tightened his grip on her arms and said, “oh
we are doing this again” and then let her go and walked away.
Youth said as Staff 3 was walking away he was yelling she was
“300 pounds and stupid”. Youth said she did not know why she
was restrained as she was “just walking”. Youth said after Staff
3 left, she and Staff 1 and Staff 2 went back to Sherk House.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on May
31, 2023. Staff 1 said on May 12, 2023, Youth was having a
very difficult day. Staff 1 said prior to the restraint episode
Youth had refused school, went into the Mask Center and was
disrupting meetings, broke peer’s bicycles, went to the Career
Technical Center (CTC) banging on doors, went into Leppien
building where construction workers were working on
renovations and was getting into binders, playing with the copy
machine and other computer equipment. Staff 1 said staff were
able to get Youth back to Sherk house where she seemed to be
self-regulated for a short time. Staff 1 said Youth’s peer had left
the house which was when Youth then decided she was also
going to walk out of Sherk House. Staff 1 said Youth went to the
Career Technical Center (CTC) and was getting on top of
vehicles, breaking antennas off vehicles, and trying to get into
all of them. Staff 1 said Youth then walked over to a sign that
2

was laying on the ground and picked it up and was threatening
staff. Staff 1 said she, Staff 2 and Staff 3 used proximity control
and continued to encourage Youth to make good choices. Staff
1 said Youth was not able to focus on what was being asked of
her, not able to carry on a conversation, and appeared
dysregulated. Staff 1 said Youth kept walking to the front the
CTC and then going back behind where there are maintenance
vehicles and supplies. Staff 1 said Youth eventually left the
CTC and began to walk to the Mask Center. Staff 1 said Youth
walked to the driveway of the Mask Center and she, Staff 2,
and Staff 3 continued to use proximity control to ensure her
safety. Staff 1 said Youth then agreed to walk back to Sherk
House and began walking down Village Road. Staff 1 said she
was using Level 1 position to hold Youth’s arm as they were
walking. Staff 1 said she was not using the hold in a restraint
manner and there was no restriction of movement. Staff 1 said
Staff 3 was on the other side of Youth while they were walking.
Staff 1 said she was unsure of what Staff 3 was doing as she
was focused on Youth. Staff 1 said Youth did a “sidestep of
some kind” and Staff 3 went into a one-person benevolent hold
which upset Youth and she dropped to the ground. Staff 1 said
Staff 3 held Youth for about one minute and then released and
walked back to his car and she and Staff 2 walked Youth the
rest of the way back to Sherk House. Staff 1 said Youth was
talking and walking in a calm manner and so she was not sure
why Staff 3 placed Youth in a hold.
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on June 2, 2023. Staff
2 said Youth was out of bounds, behind the Career Technical
Center (CTC) getting into everything she could find including
being on top of vehicles. Staff 2 said this went on for “a while”
and Staff 1 was the main staff dealing with Youth and she and
Staff 3 were there assisting. Staff 2 said eventually Youth
agreed to walk back to Sherk House and she was on the right
side of Youth and Staff 1 was on Youth’s left side. Staff 2 said
she does not remember Staff 1 having her hands on Youth in
any way. Staff 2 said Staff 3 was “frustrated that [Youth] was
not walking fast enough” and when Youth stopped walking Staff
3 went into a hold. Staff 2 said Youth sat on the ground and
Staff 3 continued to hold her. Staff 2 said the hold was “very
brief”. Staff 2 said Youth “went off on” Staff 3 and he responded
by stating “she was lucky she was a resident, or he would spit
on her”. Staff 2 said Youth was not causing harm to self or
others when Staff 3 placed her in a restraint.
3

Staff 3 was called on June 1, 2023, June 2, 2023, and June
6, 2023. Staff 3’s phone was turned off and he is no longer
employed by Eagle Village, therefore, he was unable to be
interviewed. Staff 3 did complete a narrative regarding the
restraint prior to ending his employment at Eagle Village. The
narrative is as follows:
On the date of 5/12/2023, the time in question Eagle Village
staff member [Staff 3] replied to a radio call for extra staff call
concerning a youth who had been out of bounds by the CTC
building. Upon further investigation, it was learned that youth
was [Youth]. [Youth] was walking towards the rear of the CTC
building by the buses and maintenance trucks, being followed
by Eagle Village staff member [Staff 1] and [Staff 2]. During her
time at the CTC, Youth attempted several unsafe activities,
among these actions were climbing on top of the maintenance
truck, climbing into the busses, and also opening numerous
panels for various utilities that were outside. Among these
interventions were setting limits, proximity control, and calling
the On-Call Supervisor for additional support with the situation.
In an effort to keep the environment safe staff members
maintained proximity control and verbal redirection, after
several minutes of redirection and verbal de-escalation, [Youth]
agreed to walk back to the house with staff members. At
approximately 5:30pm, before walking back to the house, [Staff
3] informed [Youth] she would not be able to walk in the middle
of the road as it was not safe, and she had already been out of
bounds in the road earlier that day. [Youth] agreed it was not
safe to walk in the road, but still began walking towards the
road. [Staff 1] used proximity control to keep [Youth] from
entering into the roadway, while [Staff 3] continued to inform
[Youth] she would not able to walk in the road. [Youth]
continued to walk towards the road until [Staff 1] engaged into
an extended level 1 arm hold. At approximately 5:33pm [Staff 3]
went to assist [Staff 1] in the level 1 hold, upon [Staff 3]
transition into the restraint [Youth] then tried to sit on the
ground. [Staff 3] immediately transitioned into the Aegis Safety
Position as a result of [Youth] dropped her weight. At
approximately 5:35pm the hold was disengaged once [Youth]
verbalized a plan to walk back to the house with staff members.
Documents Reviewed:
• MiSACWIS Incident Report # 154910209. The incident
report is consistent with Staff 1’s interview.
• Eagle Village Incident Report regarding Youth’s incidents
on May 12, 2023. This incident report outlines all of the
behaviors that Youth had throughout the day on May 12,
4

2023, including the restraint. The incident report has a
narrative regarding the restraint written by Staff 1 which
is consistent with her interview, and a narrative by Staff 3
which is documented above.
• Staff 1’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record
and Staff 1 completed the required Aegis training on
11/17/2022.
• Staff 3’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record
and Staff 3 completed the required Aegis training on
10/20/2022.
Analysis After interviews with youth and staff, it is determined the
restraint completed on Youth was not warranted as she was not
causing harm to self or other, nor was she in imminent danger.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
